definition:
Let ${\mathfrak{g}}$ be a semisimple Lie algebra, and let
$(\cdot,\cdot)$ denote the Killing form. If $\{g_i\}$ is a basis of
${\mathfrak{g}}$, then there is a dual basis $\{g^i\}$ with respect to
the Killing form, i.e., $(g_i,g^j)=\delta_{ij}$. Consider the element
$\Omega=\sum g_ig^i$ of the universal enveloping algebra of
${\mathfrak{g}}$. This element, called the [*Casimir operator*]{} is
central in the enveloping algebra, and thus commutes with the
${\mathfrak{g}}$ action on any representation.
